oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harper's Weekly from March 29, 1862
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Harper's Weekly cover features a scene titled "A Thrilling Scene in East Tennessee--Colonel Fry and the Union Men Swearing By The Flag." It is from Volume 6, No. 274. The image is traditionally thought to depict Unionist David Fry and his group of civilian bridgeburners who were responsible for the burning of the Lick Creek and Loudon bridges in Confederate-held East Tennessee in February 1862.
